Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: Draw and clearly identify two different habitats, one on land and one in water, such as a forest and a pond.
Accurately draw and label various types of plants in each habitat; for example, trees and grasses in the forest, and water lilies near the pond.
Illustrate and label different kinds of animals in each habitat, such as birds, squirrels, and insects for the forest, and fish and frogs for the pond.
Use arrows or other methods to show relationships or interactions between living things, such as which animals eat which plants.
Illustrate patterns in diversity by showing the abundance of certain plants and animals in each habitat, like more fish and aquatic plants in the pond compared to the forest.
CANNOT: There are no significant concepts that the student cannot show at this level, but minor gaps may appear, such as occasionally forgetting to label a plant or animal.
